result.execSummary:
The defendant Trenon D. Denfeld was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken in prescribed doses.  

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Comply with drug court.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Plea date on July 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Further proceedings on July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference on August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:10 p.m. - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trenon D. Denfeld appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney James Patrick McLinden appeared by video for Trenon D. Denfeld. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial. Offer has been received from ADA Lambrecht.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: 2:17 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trenon Denfeld appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Nathan Heim in court for defendant. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 06-17-22 at 3:00 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Trenon D. Denfeld
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 05-20-2022)
Prior: 2225 Fairmont St, Manitowoc, WI 54220
RE:  Possess methamphetamine as repeater, on 05-15-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess methamphetamine, possess THC-2nd offense, possess drug paraphernalia and resist/obstruct officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-23-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $250.00 cash.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Minutes.
